author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
Invoke-RestMethod has a `-FollowRelLink` switch to automatically follow relation links to get the net page of results.  If the target web service (like GitHub) has throttling, it can hit this after a few pages and fail.  Haven't thought this through if it should be tied to `-Retry` (https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5582) or separate.

Perhaps just a `-EnableThrottling` used with `-Retry` that uses some logarithmic backoff timeout if specific error codes are received from the server.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: hmm I wonder if snooping `x-rate*` headers would be helpful. i don't know how many API's use that to justify it.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus that would be an interesting way to tackle this

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: At a quick glance, `x-rate*` seems to not be consistently implemented enough to be useful. using what you propose appears to be more universal.

title: Invoke-RestMethod should support throttling for following rellinks
